Description: Foot and body sherd of Attic black-glazed pottery skyphos; interior and exterior glazed; low torus ring foot with reserved resting surface; reserved underside with two small circles and a dot; scraped groove at junction of wall and foot. Graffito on underside.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 707, no. 656, pl. 27.11)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1281)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
